summary: Harvest.art is a tax loss harvesting service for NFTs, supporting multiple EVM chains. The project is open-source, contributing to the OSS ecosystem by providing smart contracts, test fixtures, and deployment scripts under the MIT license. The grant aims to expand support for more EVM chains, enhance UX, and cover RPC service costs. The project aligns with the round's goals by enhancing Web3 accessibility and usability, and it demonstrates user-centric design and functionality.
review: Harvest.art presents a compelling case for funding within the GG23 OSS - dApps and Apps round. The project is well-aligned with the round's objectives, particularly in enhancing Web3 accessibility and usability. The open-source nature of the project, with its smart contracts and deployment scripts available under the MIT license, contributes significantly to the OSS ecosystem. The project's innovative approach to tax loss harvesting for NFTs, supporting multiple EVM chains, sets it apart in the market. However, the application could benefit from more detailed information on measurable outcomes and sustainability plans. The grant's intended use for expanding EVM chain support and UX development is clear, but further elaboration on how these developments will be measured and sustained would strengthen the application.

strengths.title: Open Source Contribution
strengths.description: The project contributes to the OSS ecosystem by providing open-source smart contracts, test fixtures, and deployment scripts under the MIT license.

strengths.title: Cross-Chain Support
strengths.description: Harvest.art supports seven EVM chains, enhancing its utility and accessibility across different blockchain networks.

strengths.title: Innovative Use Case
strengths.description: The project offers a unique service in tax loss harvesting for NFTs, differentiating itself in the market.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Measurable Outcomes
weaknesses.description: The application lacks detailed information on how the project's success will be measured and reported.

weaknesses.title: Sustainability Plan
weaknesses.description: There is insufficient information on the project's long-term sustainability and how it plans to reduce dependency on continuous donations.

changes.title: Include Measurable Outcomes
changes.description: Provide detailed metrics and methods for measuring the project's success and impact.

changes.title: Develop a Sustainability Plan
changes.description: Outline a clear plan for the project's long-term sustainability, including potential revenue models or strategies to reduce dependency on donations.
